sentences.en: "I might have known it!" Miss Burnett said with emphasis.
sentences.cn: “我早该料到了！”伯内特小姐加重语气说。

sentences.en: Do you mind if I give it a miss?
sentences.cn: 如果我决定不去，你会介意吗？

sentences.en: Every time she missed the ball she became more angry.
sentences.cn: 她总是接不到球，越来越生气。

sentences.en: He fired, missed and loaded again.
sentences.cn: 他开枪，没有打中，又上了子弹。

sentences.en: He married Miss Vancouver in 1963, or whenever it was.
sentences.cn: 他好像在1963年还是什么时候娶了当时的温哥华小姐。

sentences.en: He missed 20 games after breaking a bone in his wrist.
sentences.cn: 由于手腕骨折，他错过了20场比赛。

sentences.en: He seems completely self-contained and he doesn't miss you when you'renot there.
sentences.cn: 他似乎十分独立，你不在的时候也并不想念你。

sentences.en: I don't want to miss seeing that film on television tonight.
sentences.cn: 我不想错过今晚在电视上看那部影片的机会。

sentences.en: I never miss a chance of playing football.
sentences.cn: 我从来不错过踢足球的机会。

sentences.en: I would sooner give up sleep than miss my evening class.
sentences.cn: 我宁可不睡觉，也不愿错过晚上的课。

sentences.en: I’d like to make an appointment with Miss Taylor.
sentences.cn: 我想约一下泰勒小姐。

sentences.en: I’m absolutely starving – I missed lunch.
sentences.cn: 我饿坏了——我没吃上午饭。

sentences.en: It would be just his luck to miss the last boat.
sentences.cn: 他就这运气，误了最后一班船也毫不出奇。

sentences.en: John will be sorely missed by his family and friends.
sentences.cn: 约翰会让他的家人和朋友非常想念。

sentences.en: Miss Famous, as she was called, was a gem.
sentences.cn: “知名小姐”人如其名，是个尤物。

sentences.en: Miss Finkelstein will put a dressing on your thumb.
sentences.cn: 芬克尔斯坦小姐会为你包扎拇指的。

sentences.en: Miss Hoare called out names and marked them off.
sentences.cn: 霍尔小姐点名后把它们一一划掉。

sentences.en: Miss Parrish recently placed an advertisement in the local news-paper.
sentences.cn: 帕里什小姐最近在本埠报纸上登了一则广告。

sentences.en: missed out on the promotion.
sentences.cn: 错过提升的机会

sentences.en: people who've been holding off buying anything in case prices drop further could find they've missed the boat.
sentences.cn: 那些想价格会继续下跌而推迟购买的人会发现已经错失机会了。

sentences.en: Sergeant Cobbins was an experienced officer and didn't miss much.
sentences.cn: 科宾斯巡佐是一位经验丰富的警官，很少有东西从他眼皮底下溜走。

sentences.en: She looked at Miss Melville, snugly ensconced among her new friends.
sentences.cn: 她看了看梅尔维尔小姐，她正舒适地安坐在新朋友中间。

sentences.en: She missed her family badly.
sentences.cn: 她非常想念她的家人。

sentences.en: She was upset at missing all the excitement.
sentences.cn: 精彩部分都错过了，她很失望。

sentences.en: The bullet narrowly missed her heart.
sentences.cn: 子弹差点击中她的心脏。

sentences.en: The luscious Miss Wharton gave me a demure but knowing smile.
sentences.cn: 性感迷人的沃顿小姐对我羞涩地会心一笑。

sentences.en: the Swiss handle metres of snow without missing a beat.
sentences.cn: 瑞士人对付数米深积雪毫不在乎。

sentences.en: The teacher who took us for economics was Miss Humphrey.
sentences.cn: 教我们经济学的是汉弗莱小姐。

sentences.en: we decided to give the popcorn a miss.
sentences.cn: 我们决定不吃爆米花。

sentences.en: We were not altogether sure that the comet would miss the Earth.
sentences.cn: 我们不能完全肯定彗星不会与地球相撞。

sentences.en: Will you miss me?
sentences.cn: 你会想我吗？

phrases.phrase: a miss is as good as a mile
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)失败再小，终究是失败；错误再小，总归是错误
不论成功与否；无计划的；漫不经心的
n. 阳光小美女（电影名称）
(非正式)（尤指在严峻情况或活动间的过渡期间）犹豫，踌躇
(非正式)（行动过慢而）错过机会
没打中目标；没达到目的
n. [计]相近差错；（炸弹）近距脱靶；（车辆）侥幸免撞

trans.tran_en: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her

trans.tran_cn: 未击中，未察觉，不理解，错过，怀念，发觉丢失，避开
trans.tran_en: to not go somewhere or do something, especially when you want to but cannot
